animation module¶

platform

Unix, Windows

synopsis

This module contains the endpoint plot code. This code was adapted in part from K. Mulier’s example on stackoverflow.

moduleauthor

Michael Eller <mbe9a@virginia.edu>

class animation.CustomFigCanvas[source]¶

Bases: matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg.FigureCanvasQTAgg, matplotlib.animation.TimedAnimation

CustomFigCanvas is a class designed to allow integration of a matplotlib animation into a Qt backend. The animation will display the recorded voltage from the ADC and its corresponding differential derivative. The user can edit the axes limits and change the window filtering dynamically from the main menu.

__init__()[source]¶

Initializes the object and its parent objects. Creates the figure, axes, and artists to be displayed.

get_windowed_value(window)[source]¶

Helper function that simply calculates the average of all the samples in the window.

Parameters

window – the list containing the data to be averaged

Returns

the average

new_frame_seq()[source]¶

Return a new sequence of frame information.

addData(value)[source]¶

This function is called by the signal-slot mechanism within the plotGUI Dialog. It adds a value to the plots received data buffer, addedData.

Parameters

value – received value from the serial connection to the ADC

close()[source]¶

Soft close function. Closes the figure contained in the object.

update_xlim()[source]¶

This function handles updating the x-axis range dynamically.

generate_xticklabels()[source]¶

Since the animation progresses from right to left, the left-most point is actually in the past, i.e. negative time. The simples way to do this is to keep the axis limits from 0 to xlim and alter the labels.

update_ylim()[source]¶

Update the data y-axis limits according to the input from the user. The derivative limits are hard-coded based on the ymax of the data axis.

update_window()[source]¶

This function updates the windows_samples variable from the settings file.
